sentence.Network_en: His sporting and political interests coalesced admirably in his writing about climbing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在写登山的文章中，把自己对体育和政治的兴趣完美地结合了起来。

sentence.Network_en: Peter had dealt admirably with the sudden questions about Keith.
sentence.Network_cn: 彼得对突如其来的有关基思的问题应答自如，令人叹服。
约翰斯通的研究涉猎很广，让人钦佩。

字典中善字的解释 ... (3) 通“缮”。修治[ repair] (5) 羡慕[ admire] (6) 喜爱[ like].

entry.tran: 令人钦佩的；值得赞赏的
entry.def: An admirable quality or action is one that deserves to be praised and admired.

example.tran: 贝顿是个令人钦佩的人物。

example.ex: The film tells its story with admirable economy.
example.tran: 这部电影叙事简练，令人叹服。

auth_sentence.content: Otter reveals his true class by matching Coleman admirably.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Otter reveals his true class by matching Coleman admirably.

auth_sentence.content: Her choreography functions admirably on several literally physical planes.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her choreography functions admirably on several literally physical planes.

auth_sentence.content: The supporting cast acquit themselves admirably as well.
